    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Order​(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String order_id)
      1) Constructor for objects of class Order 2) Initialise instance variables 3) Provide the input file name and first letter of your first name and last as an order ID e.g ("input.txt" "CP") CP for Collin Peter 4) Get the list of lines from fileReader class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Order

        public Order​(java.lang.String fileName,
             java.lang.String order_id)
        1) Constructor for objects of class Order 2) Initialise instance variables 3) Provide the input file name and first letter of your first name and last as an order ID e.g ("input.txt" "CP") CP for Collin Peter 4) Get the list of lines from fileReader class. Create anonymous Product type of objects, then add them into product_list.

    • Method Detail

      • generateInvoice

        public java.lang.String generateInvoice()
        Generate invoice ID using OrderID and random generated value. String concatenation is applicable here. if orderID = "AN", and random value is 18. example output: AN18

      • placeOrder

        public double placeOrder​(java.lang.String prod_id,
                         int unit)
        1) This method must communicate with Product class 2) The method should be able to place the order using product id and unit. It will take one product item at a time. 3) Calculate the total payable amount by the customer 4) To place multiple orders method should be able to get called multiple times. The total price and total discount will be accumulated to the field variable total_price total_discount respectively. 5) Return the accumulated total price from this method
        Parameters:
        e - .g prod_id = "P10982" and unit = 2 6) Return the value with two decimal places. For Example: from 19.887 to 19.89

      • getTotalPrice

        public double getTotalPrice()
        1) This method must communicate with Product class 2) Return the accumulated total price after placing the order. 3) Return the value with two decimal places. For Example: from 19.887 to 19.89

      • getTotalDiscount

        public double getTotalDiscount()
        1) This method must communicate with Product class 2) Get the accumulated total amount of discount that has been applied after placing the order. 3) Return the value with two decimal places. For Example: from 1.113 to 1.11

      • getTotalItem

        public int getTotalItem()
        Return total number of items ordered by a customer

      • printOrder

        public void printOrder()
        print orders in the follwing format. *******Order Details******* Invoice Number: AN43 Total items :2 Amount Payable: 36.7 Discount Applied: 2.4
